sections.purpose: To dry and sterilize glassware and metal instruments using dry heat.
sections.scope: Applicable to sterilization and drying activities in the Microbiology laboratory.
procedure: Ensure the oven chamber is clean and free of combustible material.
Arrange glassware on shelves to allow free air circulation.
Close the door and set the desired temperature and time (e.g., 160–180°C for 2 hours).
Allow the unit to reach the set temperature before starting the timing.
After the cycle, switch OFF the oven and allow it to cool gradually.
Open the door cautiously and remove items using heat-resistant gloves.
Record the cycle details in the logbook.
precautions: Do not place plastic, rubber or flammable items in the oven.
Avoid opening the door during the sterilization cycle.
Ensure adequate clearance around the oven for ventilation.
Do not overload shelves beyond their rated capacity.
